sense.name: context, circumstance or background facts of a situations
sense.commentary: SETTING[+state][+social][+context][+circumstance] Note: refers to a set of surrounding facts, causes, conditions, rather than a physical locale in iitself.
sense.examples: The woman complained that her new job placed her in a hostile setting. He found the university setting to be intellectually provincial and stifling. He would have been a great king in almost any historical setting.

sense.name: an existing physical locale or environment
sense.commentary: SETTING[+location][+physical][+environment][+real] Note: refers to real locations being perceived in the real world.
sense.examples: This shady oak tree overlooking the valley is a perfect setting for our picnic. Picture yourself in a Caribbean setting, with white sand beaches and palm trees. The fall fashion shoot was done in an urban setting.

sense.name: locate or environment for a fictional work
sense.commentary: SETTING[+location][+physical][+environment][+imagined] Note: implies the locale for a fictional work, can refer to real places in the world, but in an imaginary context.
sense.examples: The setting of this play is 17th-century England. The film's setting is a post-apocalyptic earth three hundred years in the future. Her short stories have a contemporary setting.

sense.name: position on a scale, e.g., on a thermostat
sense.examples: The setting on the thermostat is too high, could you turn it down a bit? The setting on the oven reads 375 Fahrenheit. Mary's blender has twelve different settings.

sense.name: mounting or fitting for a gemstone, e.g., a ring
sense.examples: Mary has a platinum setting for her diamond engagement ring. Such a beautiful stone should be put in a better quality setting.

sense.name: a single unit of table service pieces, for one person
sense.examples: Put another place setting out because John is also coming for dinner. A formal setting includes three knives, three forks, two spoons, two wine glasses and a water glass. This silverware pattern comes in a 5-piece setting

sense.name: musical composition to accompany a text
sense.examples: The composer has written new settings for some of Emily Dickinson's poetry. It's a beautiful setting for a standard Latin mass.

sense.name: a batch of incubating eggs
sense.examples: There was evidence that a snake had taken several eggs from settings in the hen house.
